title: Program Coordinator Interview

title: Researcher Interview

In person:

- Then met with one more staff and talked for about an hour

Zoom:

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions:
1. What is your current and expected salary?
It's a quick filter, in two ways. If an applicant is making well above what we offer, I know that we shouldn't move forward with them. People almost never go backward on salary, and when they do, they rarely work out in the long term.
It tells me how senior they are. For example, a software developer making $100k and one making $150k are fundamentally different candidates.
It tells me how I should interview them. A candidate at $100k would fail the $150k candidate interview, and the $100k candidate interview would be too easy for the $150k candidate.
I get some important data. If, after interviewing several candidates for a position, I find that all of them are making more than what we're offering, I know we need to rethink our offer.
Interview Questions: why do you interested in this position.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, it was set up via e-maila and done via videochat. It lasted approximately 30 minutes or so, with plenty of time for me to ask questions at the end. Very transparent about hiring timeline
Interview Questions: Strengths/weaknesses, experience teaching, experience with diverse populations

title: Regional Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: It was a fast pace interview process after I made it past the phone screen. HR and the administrative assistants who coordinated all the interview times were so helpful.  Overall, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your leadership style and give examples of how it makes you more effective.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone. About 30 mins long. It was only the first of three stages and I heard back from them the next day.  This was great for me because though I was denied, I had closure and could move on to concentrate on other endeavors.
Interview Questions: How long are you available to work for?

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: I completed an online application. It took a few months to hear back. I then completed a phone screening and in person interview. It took a week or so to hear back about whether I got the job.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult patient situation?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: It was a conversation about my past experience, my goals, and details about the position. Professors were friendly and showing that they care about students. The while process was relaxed.
Interview Questions: In what topics are you interested in?

title: Staff Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The department I applied for was fast and communicative. It was an in-person, round table interview with other employees, but this was pre-pandemic so things might've changed since then. Easy-going and heard back from them relatively soon.
Interview Questions: Past experiences, typical workplace scenarios

title: Residential Hall Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the DUKE TIP Website. After about a week and a half, I received an email to schedule a video interview. The interview was held a few days later and I was offered the position 2 days after.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to lead?

title: Senior GMP Manufacturing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing with this group was a very intimidating process. Be honest and open about your experience and what you are looking for. Ask for transparency about holiday and weekend work.
Interview Questions: Details about aseptic technique and dilution calculations

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The Professor called me and asked me about my research background in detail. After a week or so I was sent an offer letter. I accepted it.
Interview Questions: Tell me what did you do during your PhD.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: thought provoking questions. Very in depth and how you would implement your strengths to help the company. They want to see your problem solving skills and how well you work with other people
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging decision you have made and what though process you used to make your decision.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Semi-Formal with an intention of getting to know you better and understanding basic skills and preferences as a student. Willing to know more about personal experiences as well as professional and the core values that you share with the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Applied by sending CV to the recruiting manager and waited for about 1 week to get the interview. 3 Biostatistician from the group recruiting people interviewed me. Asked some behavior questions and a paper to explain some values.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview process with normal interview questions. Took about 30 minutes to an hour speaking with interviewer. Be prepared to answer typical interview questions specifically about your work ethic.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied to be an RC online and gave a cover letter, resume and two letter of recommendation. A few days after applying they sent me an email that they wanted to interview me and asked for my availability. A few days later I had my interview over a web-video.
Interview Questions: When was a time you did not agree with and rule or policy but you still followed it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lots of great questions. Very detailed information about got the company operates. This would be a great place for any one to work. Highly recommended great culture and community through out the whole campus
Interview Questions: What are three strengths and weaknesses

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Mass interviews with multiple interviewers and multiple candidates. This similar to any interview process for residency. Nothing special. There’s not a lot more to say about it. They ask the same standard questions. Nothing new or ground breaking.
Interview Questions: Why medicine

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Houston, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, filled out a form over email and then was contacted directly over email where we set up interview. It was online, Skype call with one person. Heard back from them with offer about a month later. Kind interviewer, wasn't a lot of pressure.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict or disagreement with another person and how you resolved it.

title: Senior Financial Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They invited me to lunch with the future members of the team so they could get a feel for me joining the team. I interviewed with several key decision makers at once and back to back.
Interview Questions: Examples of work related issues you overcame.

title: Masters Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, introduce yourself. Then, you start to talk about yourself. If you get stuck in the middle, the interviewer will help you by asking some questions. Later, you are asked to explain why you applied to this program. The online interview is typically about 20 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Why you applied for this program

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward interview process, with 2 rounds. Don't shy away from showing your personality! Be sure to share your value and what you bring to the table. It was not an aggressive interview process, just know who you are!
Interview Questions: Background history and situational questions primarily.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went fairly quickly considering I was out of state, started with an in-depth phone interview, then a panel in-person interview, and finally a second, very brief interview with upper manager
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working with doctors, chairs, board members, and upper management?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions:
long but positive process...took several months and lots of waiting

It is important to keep on the ball and following up so that both parties know they are still working on a job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview with about 10 faculties. Mostly some background questions, asks about your research interests and experience and then they give a long talk about what they do. Be ready to ask them questions about the program, the students.
Interview Questions: Some get into very deep details about their research then ask for your opinion or what you think they should do.

title: Geschäftsführer / Wirtschaftsinformatiker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke University in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied late, the weekend before term 2 started. They were desperate for people and had multiple spots to fill across multiple campuses. I turned in my application and immediately got a call from a Duke Tip representative within hours. The interview happened the next day over skype. I then got an email that night around 9pm telling me I got the job.
Interview Questions: What type of programs would you create for the students?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with hiring manager, then several in-person interviews a one-on-one interview with manager and Dean of Admissions and a group interview with peers on the same day, then a 20 minute presentation
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not organized, had to meet with way too many people separately instead of together, rude and obviously showed signs of not liking their job. Left a bad first impression. Did not feel welcomed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Atlanta, GA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied in April/May 2017 and 2018 for a TA position. Both times I has contacted within a week for a skype interview. I've interviewed for the TA and Academic Program Assistant position. They asked basic things like your experience working with teens, your qualifications, and scenarios that you might have to deal with.
Interview Questions: 1. If a child said something insensitive about a certain group of people, as a TA what would you do?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview first.  The phone interview was followed by an in person interview with a supervisor, a second interview with director of programs and a 3rd interview with staff (all in one day.)
Interview Questions: How to deescalate issues concerning students who might be irate or overwhelmed student

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: it is very nice and good enviroment, people will ask basic technical questions, then shift to another person. the total time is around 45 minutes. Over all it is a great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about youtself

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was only semi-formal. I only thought I had to interview with the manager but it was with the whole team. Sat for a roundtable with the team where they asked questions about my experience, team orientation, and described the role.
Interview Questions: Have you driven a 12 passenger van before?

title: Medical Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: presentation and discussed with group/panel,  and personally talk with PI about my backgroud, current projects. PI told all projects and future projects which I will do, salary, promotion and other issues.
Interview Questions: Do you want to accept this offer?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Had two rounds of interview. The first round was with the hiring manager and questions were mainly behavioral questions. The second round was with the supervisor who I worked with, just a casual conversation without any hard technical questions.
Interview Questions: Walk me through this programming procedure.

title: MS Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Short and straightforward. The interviewer was friendly and guided me along the way. The interview was largely non-technical and was basically to gauge if I had decent communication skills and that I would be a good fit at Duke
Interview Questions: Why are you coming to Duke?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: One day interview. Met with PI for breakfast, followed by one-on-one meeting with lab members, lunch was pizza (ugh!). Seminar was 45 min, with Q&A after that. Lab members were friendly.
Interview Questions: Most questions were related to the science / research I had conducted as a PhD student.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was not too hard or too easy. It did take a while to hear what their decision was. And I had to keep making contact to hear that part.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. My skill set was a good fit for the job. The campus is busy. I would suggest studying the parking options before you drive. Not many parking options.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: HR was professional and got back to me in a timely manner. Interview process was thorough, and I met with several people within the department prior to meeting directly with my boss. It was nice to get to meet several other administrative professionals within the department during the process.
Interview Questions: What is your background? Are you a good writer? How do you think your skills from your previous positions apply to this one? What are your goals and where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was 4 separate interviews with 5 people at a time. Each person asked questions as it related to their department. Very nice group of people, but very intimidating to have 5 people interview 1 candidate
Interview Questions: why do i want the job

title: Coordinator, Business Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and application was sent to hr manager at The Divinity School. Was contacted to come in a week later. Came in and interview with 5 different people, interview was going great until they started down playing my resume saying exactly “so you didn’t supervise theses people, did you” after I went into detail about my previous position everyone got quiet and wasn’t offered any kind of explanation. Didn’t hear back until a month to the day of the interview, with a email stating I didn’t get the job.
Interview Questions: All question based on the pass experience in the position

title: Program Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a Program Lead position with the Innovations in Healthcare group in Feb 2018. Phone screen and in person interview, I thought it went well but never heard back from group.
Interview Questions: How my past experience fits in with the position?

title: Academic Video Production Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward took about a month total. Not clear about who all you will be interviewing with so don't be surprised if you have a group interview and weren't aware of this ahead of time.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your spare time?

title: Regional Development Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a complete lack of engagement throughout the process. I didn't feel welcome, either on the phone or in person. My in-person interview added little to my knowledge of the position or the institution. I had little time for questions. Interviews felt scripted rather than a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why Duke, why now?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Casual, as I knew the Principal Investigator. We spoke once about the position, and I accepted the offer. I learned more about the position and the opportunity arose when the PI's funding came through, albeit a little bit into the fall semester. I met the primary administrator and other staff during the process. All were welcoming individuals who gave me the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: if my availability matched their grant needs.

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: It involved submitting a cover letter and resume, then I was invited in for an interview. The interview involved speaking with the two directors of the center and then two employees that work there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Two intervies, one from the chair and another from the a faculty member of related field. Had been on waitlist for really long but finally got the offer five days prior to deadline.
Interview Questions: Really cannot expect. That is too long ago. Just very basic interview questions.

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a breeze, loved every bit , i was very nervous because I interviewed with more than one person.. duke is a big company and many many employers
Interview Questions: What’s your weakness

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I talked with my lab director and it was a casual and enlightening conversation. I then talked with the grant manager there and she asked me a few questions. It ended with a tour of the lab and some scientific conversation.
Interview Questions: What is the procession frequency of a hydrogen proton?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very simple questions, almost everyone who applies gets the role. As long as you present yourself well and communicate coherently. Wear presentable clothes and be open and friendly. Before the interview I applied online and wrote a short cover letter.
Interview Questions: Example of communication skills.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview individually by the 3 of the persons I would be working for.  Then the executive director interview me.   All in all it took 3 hrs.  It went well - it was a little nervous as I sat in the conference room waiting for each person.
Interview Questions: Background, why I think I would be a good fit, my skill set, general questions that you ask during a interview

title: Senior Director Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty extensive process - phone interview, then in person with a panel, then another in person with a different panel. They asked good questions and it was a fun conversation throughout. Not intimidating really, but certainly in depth.
Interview Questions: What accomplishment on your resume are you most proud of?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply through email, pass two skype interviews. In first interview, we discussed my background, and the available projects in the group.  In the second one I pick one of the projects and discuss the possible research questions
Interview Questions: How can you improve  XXX algorithm for problem XXX?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: No Interview, just application asking about time preferences, why you are interested and qualified to be a teaching assistant, and grade received in course when you took it. Takes less than 20 minutes to complete
Interview Questions: No interview

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was very easy and straight forward especially due to the employee referral. I would recommend that people apply to Duke for the benefits and ease of the process.
Interview Questions: Q: What makes you qualified for the position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and consisted of a 30 min video conference over skype. The interview was typical personality questions and some scenario questions as well. Overall very easy interview if you are meant for the job.
Interview Questions: What was one time you had difficulty working in a group, how did you overcome this?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to an interview and then told that the company had decided to go a different route and then re-invited for a interview.  It takes a while for the hiring process, about 2 months, but I got the job. One interview seemed layed back while the other seemed to judgmental and drilled a lot of questions based perceived assumptions. I was able to answer the questions at ease with being familiar with interview questions and why they are often asked. I had a phone interview. Did not meet managers in person until after hire.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your current role?
Tell me how you job is different from this role?
We worry that we will train you and then you will go somewhere else? (This is a favorite at duke)
Tell me your strengths in your current role?
What are your weakness and areas to improve?
Tell me about a time that you had a conflict with someone that you work with? 
Are their any questions that you have for me?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: It was nice! The people were really friendly, and gave me a sense for what the position would be like and what would be expected of me. Look here if you want to have a rewarding experience.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute in this role?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: A few, easy questions over the phone less than one week after I applied for the job (assuming they were short staffed). I was sent an offer minutes after the phone interview ended.
Interview Questions: What kind of activities would you incorporate if chosen for this position?

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was sent a questionnaire from a department lead. It gave me a list of possible classes to TA. I submitted essays for each class. I also met with instructor to let them know I had an interest in working for the class.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach class X?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Duke University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Checked the job positions from Duke human resource and sent a resume to PI. Got an invitation from PI within days and scheduled an interview. Gave a 30 minutes of presentation for my PhD research projects. After presentation, I was given a tour of lab and talked with all lab members one by one. Days later, I got an accepted letter from the supervisor.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our lab?

title: Benefits Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
After submitting my resume online, I got a phone call from their HR representative setting up a phone screen with the hiring manager (s). 
The phone interview was with two people, and it lasted for one hour. The conversations were pleasant. However, the last question was salary expectations, and they were very vague about it. 
I was then invited to an onsite interview with a full schedule that included talking to 12 people over the course of 4 hours. When I saw the schedule, and thought about how vague they were about pay, I lost interest in going in for the interview. However, I talked to a friend who worked there, and was told that it was standard practice to meet the entire team during interview at Duke. So I obliged and went in for an interview. 
About 1/4 way into the interview, I realized that I did not want to be there. People were very nice, but I knew it was not going to be a good fit for me. During the 4 hour long 12 people interview, I was reminded several times that I might be bored at that job given my experience and interests, which I agreed. 
I left knowing that regardless of what happened, I was not going to work there. 
Also, repeating the same thing over and over each time a new group people walked in got old really quickly. They could have done a panel interview with all 12 people present. 
A letter of "sorry we did not hire you" came in snail mail arrived a few weeks later :)
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral based questions.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked questions to get to know my work ethic. She asked about my availability for training and my access to transportation. She asked why I wanted to work at the library.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this library?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Research Interest, Resume, Meet with the faculty you wanna work with. I was a Duke alumni, I was referred by my advisor.  Have the OPT and EAD card issued before starting to work.
Interview Questions: What's your interest

title: Building Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Put in a application on December 19, 2016. Application was forwarded to hiring manager. Received a phone call on January 11, 2017 to do a phone interview no email sent before hand to tell me I was going to be interviewed. After the interview waited two weeks and followed up with hiring manager, hiring manager had been on vacation. Told me he would follow up with me, a week later February 8, 2017 checked the status and was no longer under consideration. Complete waste of my time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first round is the skype interview which seems more like an informal conversation about your research and a chance to know more about theirs. It is useful to be thorough with your research accomplishments ie be very technical! Make sure you've gone through your CV and that you've revised technical findings from all your past projects.
Interview Questions: Describe your research (make a ~10 slide ppt presentation)

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, no behavioral type interview questions, interviewed with 2 people. I was screened by a nurse recruiter first, then interviewed in person and was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress

title: Residnetial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Manhattan, KS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied, had phone interview, followed by Skype interview. Both relatively short. The time between each was also short, I heard back a few days after each round. Pretty laid back.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you had to make an unpopular decision.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applying via the Duke jobs website is clunky and tedious. But I was brought in for a panel interview with several in the department. Very pleasant, engaging conversation. Had to take a writing test that was a little awkward but understood the reason for it.
Interview Questions: How do you juggle working with a lot of different decision makers?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: This was a very straightforward and friendly interview, casual and low stress.  I had little to no prior experience in office administration but the interviewer was kind and appreciated my experience in the arts.
Interview Questions: Was asked about prior experience with office administration as well as dance.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview if you know what job you are going for then you have nothing to worry about . I get a lot of practice from the interviews
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Staff Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was automatically notified it was now with the manager 9 days later, phone interview less than a week later, asked to come in person another week later. Interviewed in person and met at least 10 different staff members from different areas. I spent over 4 hours on campus. I wish I was told it would take up my whole day. Ended up having to pay for my own parking and since it was during lunch time, I was really hungry halfway through the day. 20+ days later, I was emailed that I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Recreation Center Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I set up an interview with the supervisor of the weight room at the Wilson Recreation Center. It was semi-formal and somewhat personable.  The interview itself was probably about 10-15 minutes, but we talked overall for a little over half an hour.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for campus recreation?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy. It seemed like more of a backwards interview, where they were trying to convince you to come to duke more-so than figuring out whether or not you should be there. This was an interview in the ECE department, so I'm not sure if every other department works the same way.
Interview Questions: What was your favorite thing about Duke so far?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I already knew the employer, and received an email over the summer about interviewing for the position. I met with two members of the Duke Arts faculty and was asked about my experience on campus, why I've gotten involved in the arts, and why I was interested in the position. Very typical questions, nothing out of the ordinary and no difficult questions.
Interview Questions: What are you involved with on campus?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted by the professor whom I am working with right now. Overall, the process was nice and smooth. Most the questions I was asked during the interview process were behavior questions. And also, I gave a presentation in front of all the group members of the group I was applying for. They were all friendly and asked some technical questions about my previous research projects.
Interview Questions:
What is your previous research experience?
How can you contributed to our research group?
What is your strength and weakness in terms of research?

title: Duke TIP Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted General Application through Online Portal - Required to Submit Transcript and Have Two References Fill Out a Questionnaire. Received Skype Interview Invitation Shortly After with Head Hiring Coordinator for Instructors. Prior to the interview, I was asked to draft a sample lesson plan that I presented during my interview.  Received offer on spot during the Skype Interview for an Instructor Position that coordinator was not able to fill earlier in TIP's application cycle. A Couple Things to Note:  It definitely helps to make an impression if you're a TIP alumnus and/or Duke alumnus. Be aware of the program's mission and be prepared to speak to your ability to work with kids. Be passionate about the mission. It's more about the hiring managers assessing cultural fit and seeing if there's a position that they believe you could fill across TIP's programs.
Interview Questions: How would you manage any disruptions in the classroom?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1. introduce my research experience. 2. Why you are interested in computer hardware. 3. What do you want to do in the future? 4. What course project have you done?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter online to the Duke TIP website and filled out the online application.  I was sent an email the following day requesting a SKYPE interview. I did the interview online. Two days later, I got a job offer. I was required to take online training before starting to work. The interviewer was in North Carolina.
Interview Questions: How would you divide a three hour time block into instruction to engage middle school aged students?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I talked to a recruiter at virtual career fair. They were very friendly and direct. Said that they reviewed my resume and think I would be a good match for the Instructor position. Then a few days later they scheduled a Skype interview and told me that I will receive a definite answer in the next 2-4 weeks, which I did.
Interview Questions: The first part of the skype interview were just general questions about my education and teaching experience. Then they asked me to send a designed teaching curriculum which they will review.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and to the point. The hiring manager was very nice and straight forward. I think he makes a very good manager. I feel very confident just waiting to hear from the recruiter. I was told it would take at least two weeks to receive a job offer
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this company?

title: Imaging Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Cordial and professional.  Met with the hiring manager who is the department assistant director and an operations specialist.  The director was not available but escorted me to meet the head of the division.
Interview Questions: What come to Duke?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The only interview question was "can you use Microsoft office system or not. There was nothing technical or behavioral. Nothing unexpected. The Professor's assistant was quite friendly and supportive. No one on one interview. The process was quick and straightforward. Wish interviewers are all like this.
Interview Questions: Can you use MS Office?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy; typical interview questions about why you want to tutor, as well as miscellaneous behavioral questions about your personality and techniques for helping other people.  The process took longer than expected, considering that tutors are always in need, but all the interview questions just seemed to be a formality.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a tutor?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone. Very easy. I talked to Julia from the Remittances, Migration, and Development program. It was very straightforward. Julia was also very eager to answer my questions, and she was very kind. It was mainly an interview about my interests, and why I wanted to work there.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: We interviewed with 7 different faculty members 1:1 and met two more in group sessions. Then there were multiple outings to talk and drink with the entire department. It was great but stressful.
Interview Questions: Describe and draw an action potential.

title: Cardiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sat down in the main office. They offered me some coffee and we began engaging in conversaition. It was kind of informal unit they started asking about my knowledge in nuclear engineering processes.
Interview Questions: dont remember exactly what i said

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I only had one round. I had a skype interview with the on site director and they were all very professional. It was a good experience.  Heard back a few weeks later and it was all very streamlined. The overall experience of the interview was very good and I had a great time talking to the people.
Interview Questions: Why Duke?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: A written application with references is the first step and it's important you show your worth on these.  Follow up is a skype interview with a regional director for the campus's they are looking for.  General get to know you questions and to see if you are appropriate for the position.  Additionally if you a former TiPster you definitely have an advantage.
Interview Questions: Basic interview about why you want the job and your experience working with kids.

title: Technology Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Asked normal questions about experience in customer service and IT. The interview takes place in their office and two people interview you. Very informal and not stressful. Once I finished the interview and applied online, they sent me an email a few days later.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question was how I would handle certain situations.

title: Summer Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very casual with the Professor in question, but may vary group to group. The entire length was less than an hour. There were no technical questions other than follow up questions to things that I said about past research experience. Made sure that I was available full time and willing to complete some "grunt" work type tasks in addition to academic research.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about my research experience in physics/biomedical engineering, undergraduate coursework, and career goals.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: in writing, by telephone and in person with program director who was very pleasant and provided a lot of information on the program, its history and present status.  discussed department setup and resources available for utilization by instructor and students. very comfortable atmosphere at lunch during discussion. no questions that were unrelated to program and university needs. provided references who were all contacted.  process was very comprehensive, transparent, fair
Interview Questions: interview questions all were relating to specific subject matter for the position; knowledge base, any past direct experience, differences and similarities in position offered and prior positions, resources available to instructor and students were explained, got a good understanding of particular program and expectations, what might be flexible and what wasn't

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Only applicable to students- hire from within undergrad community and within majors. Definitely becomes easier to get a job as you get older. Research positions are not hard to get but often require a connection.
Interview Questions: prior research experience

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer who was also the hiring manager was pretty stiff and cold, read directly from the script, no warmth.  I don't think she even really knew enough about the job I was interviewing for.  She seemed pleasant enough, but I definitely wasn't sold on working there.
Interview Questions: She immediately got to the salary question of what my minimum requirement was and then wanted to know my salary history.  I always find this off putting.  Wouldn't you want to ask me questions regarding my capabilities for the job as well as inform me of the designated salary range and then ask me if I'm still interested after hearing what the range is?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: A phone screen along with a few simple programming challenges to write followed by an in-person interview with the entire team as a whole and then one on one with the manager.
Interview Questions: Primarily how I gained experience in the skills I had listed on my resume.

title: Student Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Full-day Interview with presentation included, meeting different heads of department. The interview process was straight forward.  I was asked to prepare a presentation as part of the interview.  Meeting individually with heads of departments as well as with groups of staff, and students.  I was also asked questions as it related to my experience and the presentation.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're a good fit for this role?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied with my resume, and got an email a few weeks later asking if I could take a certain shift for the semester.  I really didn't have an in-person interview, although they may have changed it now.
Interview Questions: Why the library?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Typical PhD interview process. We were brought to Durham for the day and interviewed with several research groups. If chosen then we were offered admission provided that we would work with a group that made the offer.
Interview Questions: There weren't many questions, and all were in reference to specific things I had done in the past.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview. The requirement is to get high credit on the course and apply for the position. Sometimes they need you to pass some simple test as well, but not always.
Interview Questions: What is your score of last year course?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was two fold. I had to first interview directly with the person I would be doing research with. He asked me many questions specific to the cases that I would be working on. He then gave me an evaluation task that included an assessment of the theory he was working on and a search of relevant material. Only after I passed the evaluation task was I offered a job.
Interview Questions: What critiques do you have of my theory?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved meeting with a variety of directors and administrators over the course of two days and included a presentation to a large group as well as breakfast, lunch, and dinner groups. Each meeting was peppered with questions regarding real and hypothetical situations, gathering feedback on how I would respond to each situation were I to be in the position. Interviewers took copious notes during my interview, and it turns out, an internal candidate who was in the interview process had already secured the position. I gave two days of free consultation to tell this person how to do the job.
Interview Questions: Questions revolved around student situations, surveys, and general dealings within the university.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by on-site. Met with a total of 8 people from the department. The environment was very welcoming. Interview lasted 4 hours. Had dinner with the boss afterward. Overall, very pleased with the experience and the organization.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the job?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not too intense. I was chosen because I had done exceptionally well in my math classes here at Duke. Beyond that, all they really wanted to do was make sure I possessed the necessary social skills to be an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant. I was referred by a professor who taught a class in which I was a student. My performance in her class was very likely more important than the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a teaching assistant?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by a day and a half on campus with several meals, meetings with staff, presentations, and individual interviews. Everyone was really open and welcoming. Met with collaborators across campus as well as some students. It was more casual than I expected for a private university, and people were also very candid about the benefits and challenges of working at the University.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Duke?

title: Associate In Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got referred by another faculty member, and was invited to interview based on my credentials.  It was a very laid back, informal meeting in the lab space, and most of the time was spent discussing the lab's ongoing research.  I got the feeling that it was more of a "checking for mutual interest/fit" sort of thing, rather than a conventional interview.
Interview Questions: What are your ultimate career goals, and how long do you see yourself in this position?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone call interview first, just to get to know a little bit more about me.  Then it was followed up with a Skype interview where I got to ask management some questions about how they did things and about my potential role.
Interview Questions: Whether I had experience working with students, and if so in what capacity?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Done over email, the process was quite informal, questions about my experience working with the program, and interest in taking on a larger role as graduate assistant. I was asked to apply for the position by the program director, who then reviewed my application and let me know within days that I had received the position.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to take on more responsibility with this program?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group Q&A, presentation, case study, meeting with Dean, meeting with assistant dean. You meet with the hiring manager at the beginning, provide basic info about yourself, give a 30 minute presentation on a topic of your choosing in front of admissions team, take part in case study in front of team, meet with dean of admissions, meet with hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How would you reconcile a student you like personally, but isn't academically rigorous?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
This was a pretty standard academic interview.  My experience was a bit peculiar, since I was continuing along in the lab where I did my PHD, but typically, the process goes something like this:
Duke will fly a candidate in the night before before handing the candidate off to the lab recruiting them.  The candidate will then spend 1 day meeting and interviewing with the individual members of the lab.  At some point, the candidate will be asked to give a 1 hour seminar to the prospective lab (smallest case) or the department in which the lab belongs.  Afterwards, lab members/the PI will usually take a day or two to decide on whether to give the candidate an offer.
Interview Questions: How do your research interests in X fit with our interests Y and Z?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I walked into the PI's lab and he pretty much just asked me about my prior lab experiences and what I expected to gain by working in his lab. He told me about his research and a few of the projects that his lab was working on etc. Honestly he was really easy going.
Interview Questions: What effect does an amino acid alteration  have on a protein?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Duke University (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply through a portal online. You answer all the basic questions about your experience and why you want to do the job. They either reject you or offer to do a phone interview, which lasts much less than an hour. The interview is very relaxed and simple. They ask you basic questions which you can answer with common sense. They dont immediately hire you-- you wait and they email you later with a contract you can accept or reject.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Professor asked my willingness in the email. After about one week, I met him and had some conversation after his class. I also heard other candidate to have discussion with him in his office
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience to deal with data?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online. I was then asked in for an interview which consisted of a few typical interview questions as well as me presenting a miniature lecture to my interviewer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a teaching assistant?

title: Comparative Medicine Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Typically start off with a phone interview. If that goes well, they will bring you in to start as a temporary employee. Once you have completed your 90 days, you will have a face-to-face interview in front of a number of managers/ supervisors.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about using animals for medical research?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with multiple professors.  Most professors were interested in asking me about my background.  Then they each spoke about their ongoing and proposed research.  I asked several questions showing interest and hopefully understanding.
Interview Questions: What research have you done in the past?

title: Online Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a skype phone call with members of the administration and hiring team, during which time they asked standard interview questions as well as asking about specific scenarios likely to be encountered while on the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do to motivate uninterested/unengaged learners?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone or in person interview.  It was a one round interview but a panel would go over the candidate's responses to decided.  Usually with the hiring recruiter. They got back within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions , questions about past experience, strengths and weaknesses.

title: Guest Services/Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a behavioral interview and the manager made me feel very comfortable. The questions were practical and not general. The manager explained to me exactly what would be my responsibilities, the environment, the training e.t.c. Also, the manager gave me a tour and I met some of my colleagues. I got a quick feedback and started the training.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer is impolite?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Had one interview to land a student-worker job. Pretty straightforward. It's not really a matter of whether you fit, more of whether you're willing to do the work. Afterwards, it takes probably a week to get started on a project an working. The payment system is antiquated but I think they're finally moving towards a direct deposit option for all.
Interview Questions: Like I said, it was straightforward.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: Called me via phone and set up an in person interview after a brief phone interview. I went in for the in person interview and thought it went well but didn't hear anything back for a week and a half. Then 2 weeks after I interviewed I received an email that they had hired someone else for the position.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and why have you not been able to recognize them and turn them into strengths?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was assigned a professor to work with. There was not a formal job interview. I was in a program and part of the process was to do two semesters of Teaching assistance work
Interview Questions: What Experience i had in the field

title: Field Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. Went in, discussed my availability, my prior experience with softwarew such as excel, my ability to work effectively as part of a team. It was over in 20 minutes and then there was 10 minutes or so spent chatting pleasantly about the day, the weather, my broader hopes for the future, etc. Truly a very congenial atmosphere. From the get go they were interested in me as a person.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with excel?

title: IT Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a lengthy one.  After applying, I didn't hear anything for over a month.  Later, I received a phone call from their HR department, and they gave me a phone screen.  Next, I got a call from the hiring manager, then later a call from the department manager.  They then asked me in for an in-person interview, then asked me to come back for a panel interview and a personality and skills test.  It took forever.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted around 45 minutes, it was semi-informal, and more about personal traits and ideas for the role than experience. This is generally the tone for student interviews for this role however I think it varies largely on the professor employing. Some may even elect to have their current assistants interview new recruits.
Interview Questions: What do you think might be beneficial for the students in terms of hands on application of the material?

title: Student IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: You come in for an interview with Erin, most likely, and one of the student supervisors. They ask you what you know about computers and so long as you know how to maintain your own computer with antivirus software, weekly cleanups, etc you should do fine. The software the OIT uses for clientele's computers just so happened to be the freeware I use on my own computer so I inadvertently showed I was savvy and they seemed pleased.
Interview Questions: There wasn't one. It was very much a behavioral interview

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly Straight forward-- started with a phone interview with mid-level management, came in for an in-person interview with the same folks and had a meeting with the Associate Dean before the hiring was official. The interview was not difficult. Questions were as basic as what you could google and find online. Be prepared to explain how you fit into Duke's culture (whatever that is) and smile! (Seriously it was very easy).
Interview Questions: How would you handle multiple projects at once?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with the advisor to learn about the opportunity and was asked to convey my interest via email in a week. After doing a brief research on potential advantages of working on the proposed project, I conveyed my interest, following which I was called for an on-site interview, which was scheduled for in about 4 weeks. All travel arrangements were made by the employer. It was almost a day-long interview (8 AM - 2 PM), and included one-on-one with graduate students, postdocs and research faculty and an hour-long presentation session later that afternoon. The interview ended with a one-to-one interview with the advisor himself.
Interview Questions: Most questions were on past experience and projects

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took 30 minutes for phone interview and half day  for on-site interview.  I got a job offer right away.  Then, I took about 10 days to accept the job offer.
Interview Questions: Ask About the research I did for my PhD

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a 20-minute interview with the two supervisors on the phone. They alternated asking me questions about my prior work experiences and education. Then they asked if I had any questions, and answered all of mine. At the end of the interview, they said that they were going to review the applicants' and their abilities, and possibly schedule an in-person interview to finalize their decision. However, a few weeks later I received a call saying that I was offered the position, with no additional interviews.
Interview Questions: What coursework have you taken in statistics?

title: Duke TIP Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position at the end of March and was called in during the first week of April. The interview was held at the TIP office in Durham. I was offered the opportunity to interview via skype. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and I was asked which campus did I prefer teaching.
Interview Questions: Are you going to stay in the field of education?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview with hiring manager, followed by three in-person interviews, first with  department faculty administrators (e.g., Director of Graduate Studies, Chair of Education, hiring manager), then with prospective co-workers (including hiring manager), then with Chair of academi department.
Interview Questions: Can you talk about a situation where you felt creatively challenged, and how you went about finding a solution?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sort of haphazard depending on the lab you want to work in. Usually pretty basic questions and not a whole lot of pressure. One interview with a lab manager wound up with only a couple of questions asked and the rest of the time was him waxing eloquent about various scientific issues! Still, it was definitely just a relaxed atmosphere with a lot of very intelligent individuals. They are not interested in grilling you or making you sweat to earn the job. Pretty typical interview questions, plus maybe some based on the topic of interest that the particular lab is working on. I can't think of any real hard technical questions that they asked, most of it was knowledge I had as a result of my education in a related area. You can expect to speak with several individuals, but that's not that bad considering you'll probably be working pretty closely with them for however long you will be in the lab. Most of it is probably to determine if you'll be content doing lab drudgery and if you'll fit the culture of the particular lab in question.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for this lab?

title: Director International Projects Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke University
Interview Descriptions: applied the job from posting.  first round of on-site met with direct supervisors and other people who would work with the candidate.  Second round on-site met with other people in the school.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. Asked about past work experience and responsibilities. First was short phone interview. Was then brought in for a roughly 20 minute in person interview and was hired on the spot. It was a very chill environment and not intense at all. The people at the rec center will all very nice and helpful.
Interview Questions:
Past work experience:
CPR overview:

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was great. one phone interview initially, then another phone interview. then on campus interview for a full day. the interviewers were very helpful and friendly. They asked very basic question to get to know me better. There were hardly any difficult questions. VEry neutral interview process.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Staff Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: 45 minutes of boilerplate interview questions.  It was an hour to an hour and fifteen minutes.  One on one with supervisor.  Later on there was a casual 20-30 minute meeting with two senior management staff.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses?  How do you handle stress? What skills are germane to this position?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed the day after I submitted my resume/letter to HR. The interview was set-up on a Monday (I submitted my application on the Thursday before). It was unclear via email how many people would be interviewing me. (FYI--I have interviewed at other Duke University departments before) The way this interview was done was different from previous Duke interviews: I was in a room at the head of the table with four people sitting in front of me. The four people did not really describe their roles and it was unclear (at first) who was the most senior. Their questions were clearly for someone with little experience as it was an entry-level position but, I have a lot of  experience so responding to their questions was a bit more challenging. I was not ready for such basic questions as "Are you punctual?" So, be ready for some basic questions if you are applying for a support staff/entry level position. They asked for my references which I submitted the next day via email. They said they were traveling for two weeks but would be in touch in the coming weeks. When I followed up three-weeks post-interview I was told "things take time here at Duke, please be patient." Two days later I got an email saying I was no longer under-consideration for the position. In general I think Duke tends to ask the typical questions you find online for interviews.
Interview Questions: Are you punctual? (seems simple but for someone with a lot of experience it was somewhat challenging/insulting to answer--I felt like they had not looked at my resume and I felt like considering our limited time, there are better questions to ask….)

The interviewer was most interested in my teaching experience, my experience working with teenagers, my expertise in the subject I wanted to teach, and my ability to manage behavioral issues in a class of 18-20 gifted teens. He also asked me about my ability to interact with parents and teens on the autism spectrum.
Interview Questions: How are you going to handle teaching a biological science class to a group of teenagers spread across 4  different grades (ages 13-16) when older students have taken several science classes whereas younger students have not? How are you going to make sure that every single student remains engaged and keeps learning in your class every day? Please be specific.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
After you submit your application to PhD programs in December, usually Duke would start invite people for onsite interviews at mid-January to early Febuary. There will be a little flexibility of choosing the date of your onsite interview, Duke will cover your flight and hotel expenses. 

You will be able to name the 3-5 faculty members you are interested in and Duke will do their best in obtaining the interviews. Each faculty member will talk to you for around 15 minutes, during which they learn about your past experience, research interests and also introduce you to their research. Make sure you ask enough questions to help you determine whether you would see yourself working with this specific professor in the future. You will also have the oppportunity of talking to the current graduate students in the program through social hangouts (remember this is also part of the interview too as the current students will be asked to redflag anyone not fit for the program after the interview). It is always helpful to ask the current students on the research areas of faculty members in the program, and have a glimpse into their mentoring style if the current students are willing to share this information.

A great match = research your are interested in + mentoring style that fits your preference + supportive student body that are also intellectually stimulating. Duke overall is more laid-back than other universities, but some PhD programs within Duke can be more intense.
Interview Questions:
1. What did you do for your master/ undergraduate thesis?
2. Why are you interested in research topic XXX?
3. What do you like about Duke?
4. What do you want to do after graduating from the PhD program?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke University (Durham, NC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I went through the standard PhD application process: submitting GRE scores, two writing samples, three recommendations, all my transcripts in electronic and hard copy, and a personal statement. There were no in-person interviews as part of the process. However, once accepted, the department invited (and flew in and accommodated) all the accepted students that year to a "prospective visit" where you had the chance to meet your incoming cohort, older graduate students, and have one-on-one information interviews with the professors of your choice. There were also social events and tours of the housing in the area. The whole process was incredibly friendly and fast: all the US universities have an April 15th acceptance deadline for applicants, so if you are accepted, you will know by late Jan / Feb (so only a month or so after application deadlines). That way the department can plan to fly you in for the prospective visit and try to "convince" you to work with them, as opposed to the other universities you might have an offer from. It's incredible and there is nothing else like it in academia in other countries!
Interview Questions: What are your career plans after the PhD.
